issue.title: 438: Reference resolution of Product references (and set of) as an attribute of nested type

repository.name: commercetools-sync-java
repository.description: Java library for importing and syncing (taking care of changes) data into one or more commercetools projects from external data files or from another commercetools project.

issue.body:
#### Summary
Addresses #438 

#### Important to Note

The test `resolveAttributeReference_WithNullReferenceInSetAttribute_ShouldResolveReferences` is disabled due to a possible bug on https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2442. If this PR is ready to be merged, we can create an issue for this and merge this. --> https://github.com/commercetools/commercetools-sync-java/issues/441
#### Todo

- Tests
    - [x] Unit 
    - [x] Integration Tests
- [x] Add Release Notes entry.

issue.title: Bug on FasterXML/jackson-databind on arrayNode adding null values.

repository.name: commercetools-sync-java
repository.description: Java library for importing and syncing (taking care of changes) data into one or more commercetools projects from external data files or from another commercetools project.

issue.body:
### Description
The test `resolveAttributeReference_WithNullReferenceInSetAttribute_ShouldResolveReferences` is `disabled` due to a possible bug on FasterXML/jackson-databind#2442. 

This was added in this PR: https://github.com/commercetools/commercetools-sync-java/pull/439

It should be investigated whether we should handle this bug on the library or wait for fix while documenting it's consequences on the library's usage.

body:
First of all: thank you for reporting the issue! Yes, that looks like a problem, although surprisingly one that has not been reported before. I agree that raw `null` is not to be added; and to me it seems there are 2 possibilities: either automatically "upgrade" `null` as is done in a few other places, or throw an exception to indicate invalid value.

It seems reasonable to expect former, so that `null`s would be automatically coerced, given that this happens elsewhere.

I'll think about this bit more, and will get fixed for `2.10` to be included in 2.10.0.

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

body:
Hi @cowtowncoder, thanks for the quick reply. I also agree with you about the former being the more suitable solution to be consistent with the rest of the methods. 

I attempted to provide a fix for it here: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/pull/2443

rename.from: ArrayNode#addAll adds raw null values which cause NullPointerException on ArrayNode#deepCopy and ArrayNode#toString
rename.to: `ArrayNode.addAll()` adds raw `null` values which cause NPE on `deepCopy()` and `toString()`

body: any expected date when 2.10.0 will be released?
@heshamMassoud Hoping to release before end of September, ideally within 2 weeks.
